dict.string: Detect in/out of pocket does what it says. It will detect when it is placed vertically into or taken out of (vertically) a pocket, and will either turn the screen the screen off or lock. See “Pocket Settings” for more information.
Enabled on face up will turn the screen off and apply toggles when the screen is layed flat face up.
Enable SmartCover will apply FaceOff’s toggles when the iPad SmartCover is covering the screen.
Use proximity sensor will use the proximity sensor to turn the screen on/off and apply toggles or alternate actions.
Disable proximity in landscape will disable dimming with the proximity sensor in landscape mode. This makes it possible to type in landscape mode.
Only enable proximity on AC will enable the proximity sensor when on AC (charging) only

Proximity mode is the way FaceOff handles proximity events. In standard mode, it will turn on/off with the proximity being covered/uncovered. For example: proximity covered; turn screen off. Proximity uncovered; turn screen on. On/Off mode will require one covering to turn off and one to turn back on. For example: proximity covered; turn screen off. Proximity uncovered; screen stays off. Proximity covered again; screen comes back on.
Sensitivity modifies how flat the device must be to turn on/off

The delay options will change a delay for turning the screen on/off. The proximity delay is independent of other delays. So if you had both a delay and a proximity delay it would wait both of those combined. However if you just had a proximity delay, it would not activate when the proximity sensor is covered until the delay has been fulfilled.
The toggles page contains a list of toggles to apply when dimming. See that page for more information/a list of toggles
Disable on AC will disable FaceOff when the device is on AC (charging)
Disable lighting up for LS notifications will attempt to stop the lock screen from coming on when the device receives a notification. Also see my other tweak OnlyOneNotification ;)
Enable while locked lets FaceOff run on the lock screen and while locked.
Lock/unlock options contains a list of options for modifying how FaceOff works when lock instead of dim is on.

”Disable in apps” is a blacklist for apps not to run FaceOff in. The disable on homescreen/disable in all apps should not need much explanation, and they do not disable on the lock screen - just in what they say.

Enable dim delays will enable both the Auto-Dim delay and the Lockscreen delay. Both of those delays have text entry fields, although please enter a number or SpringBoard may crash... The “(8)” next to the Lockscreen delay is the default lockscreen dim time. The disable/enable on AC toggles should be fairly self-explanatory =P.
